sections.heading: Database Backup and Recovery
sections.content: Implement automated backup strategies including full, incremental, and differential backups. Test recovery procedures regularly. Maintain backup retention policies and secure off-site storage.

sections.heading: API Rate Limiting - Security
sections.content: Implement rate limiting to prevent abuse and ensure fair usage. Common strategies include token bucket, sliding window, and fixed window algorithms. Return 429 Too Many Requests with Retry-After header.

sections.heading: Input Validation - Security
sections.content: Validate all user inputs on both client and server sides. Use allowlists, sanitize data, and implement proper encoding. Protect against SQL injection, XSS, and other injection attacks.

sections.heading: Kubernetes Pods - Container Management
sections.content: A Pod is the smallest deployable unit in Kubernetes. It represents a single instance of a running process and can contain one or more containers. Pods share storage and network resources within the same node.
